citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a protease-producing, thermophilic, anaerobic bacterium, Thermobacteroides leptospartum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Thermobacteroides leptospartum sp. nov.
Thermobacteroides leptospartum (lep.to.spar'tum. Gr.n. leptos thin; Gr.n. sparton rope; L.n. leptospartum thin rope)
Morphology
Rods, 0.25~0.45 μm wide by 4.5~15 μm long.
Single or paired cells.
Gram-negative and non-motile.
Endospores not formed.
Colonies are uniformly round, non-pigmented and flat, and grow to a diameter of 2~3mm in roll tubes in 4~5 days.
Cellular characteristics
DNA base composition of 43(±2) mol% G+C, on HPLC.
Catalase not detectable.
Multilayered cell wall architecture without an outer wall membrane.
Whole-cell fatty acids mainly composed ofn-C16:0, iso-C17:0 and iso-C15:0.
Temperature and pH relationship
Optimum temperature for growth 60°C, maximum <71°C and minimum >45°C; pH range for growth is between 6.7 and 8.9 (optimum 7.5) at 60°C.
Physiology
Chemoorganotroph.
Utilizes various saccharides as energy sources including lactose, glucose, galactose, cellobiose, xylose, mannose and maltose, but not fructose or sucrose.
Obligate anaerobe.
Growth inhibited by air, neomycin, polymyxin B and gentamicin.
Major fermentation end products on glucose include ethanol and acetate, but not lactate or butyrate.
H2S and indole not produced.
Nitrate not reduced.
Esculin hydrolyzed. Habitat.
This strain was isolated from cattle manure in Ehime prefecture, Japan.
The type strain is strain C-17-70 (=IAM 13499).
